justifications: One, the contemptible character of the mainstream media.
The elite mainstream media, especially the financial media, is intolerable.
The Brexit coverage should surely show that the daily sacrifice is not worth the candle.
This from the super smug Financial Times: 'Britain takes a leap into the dark. …Britain's decision to leave the EU is the biggest shock to the continent since the fall of the Berlin Wall.'
The Economist, if at times sober, declaimed: 'After the vote, chaos. … June 23rd will be a landmark in British and European history.'
John Lloyd (a contributing editor at the Financial Times no less) blesses Reuters readers with a condescending inconsequential piece titled '… the chaos that will be felt around the world'.
Said the Guardian, now running on empty.
